title: ICE - trying to take the sizing type of <core::iter::Iterator + 'static as core::iter::Iterator>::Item, an unsized type

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: A-associated-items
labels.description: Area: Associated items such as associated types and consts.

body:
### Code

```
fn changer<'a>(mut things: Box<Iterator<Item=&'a mut u8>>) {
    for item in *things { *item = 0 }
}

fn main() {
}
```
### Error

```
error: internal compiler error: trying to take the sizing type of <core::iter::Iterator + 'static as core::iter::Iterator>::Item, an unsized type
note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.
note: we would appreciate a bug report: http://doc.rust-lang.org/complement-bugreport.html
```
